Description: Fragment of a limestone plane surface. Both of the smooth surfaces connect to each other on a 85 degrees angle. The thinner surface is smooth and has some traces of tooling and on top of it some remains of mortar. Which one is the upper or the lower surface is not distinguishable. The fragment was made of a light limestone with brown spots. A series of circles was painted in blue, white, and red; these are now much faded.
Curator's comments: Curator’s comment: Pryce describes the fragment with following words: “Fragment of a plane surface, on which a series of circles was paint in blue, white, and red; these are now much faded.” The paint was already in 1999 not visible. Published (Koenigs 2007, 348 Cat. 47; Smith 1892, no. 101, 3).
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B399)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.47, p.348.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.60) (Phase 3)
